name: TI_2_1_3_System_Audit_Triggers
title: TI.2.1.3 System Audit Triggers (Function)
purpose: System Audit Triggers are designed to capture system related events, both routine and exceptional, including key metadata (who, what, when, where, why).

statement.label: TI.2.1.3#01
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to log system maintenance events for loading new versions of, or changes to, the clinical system.

statement.label: TI.2.1.3#02
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to store system maintenance events for loading new versions of codes and knowledge bases.

statement.label: TI.2.1.3#03
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to log system maintenance events for creating and restoring of backup.

statement.label: TI.2.1.3#04
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to audit events in the case of detection of corrupt or dirty data.

statement.label: TI.2.1.3#05
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to audit the access and usage of systems, data, and organizational resources.

statement.label: TI.2.1.3#06
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to log system events at the hardware and software architecture level.

statement.label: TI.2.1.3#07
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to log system maintenance events for entry to, and exit from, the EHR system.

statement.label: TI.2.1.3#08
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to log system maintenance events for remote access connections including those for system support and maintenance activities for security and access purposes.
